page.title: 01THE LANDSCAPE IN BRIEF
page.content: THE BLOCK FALLS NATURALLY INTO THREE MAIN AREAS__ALL RURAL IN CHARACTER. IN THE WEST THE RIVER AVON MEANDERS FROM NORTH TO SOUTH AND IS SURROUNDED ON BOTH SIDES BY FLAT WATER MEADOWS. THE LAND RISES TO THE EAST OF THE AVON AND THE MIDDLE SECTION COMPRISES FARMLAND AND WOODLAND, TOGETHER WITH THE VILLAGE OF WOODGREEN WHICH COMES WITHIN THE NEW FOREST PERAMBULATION. THE EASTERN AREA OF THE BLOCK,ALSO IN THE NEW FOREST,CONSISTS LARGELY OF HEATH AND MOORLAND AND CONTAINS THE VILLAGE OF HALE. HALE AND WOODGREEN FORM ONE PARISH. BOTH VILLAGES HAVE GREENS WHERE PONIES AND CATTLE GRAZE ,CHILDREN PLAY,AND CRICKET MATCHES AND OTHER SOCIAL EVENTS TAKE PLACE.
